title: 80-Mile 2021 Ford GT Carbon Series
description: This 2021 Ford GT was originally delivered to Galpin Ford of North Hills, California, and it was optioned with the “lightweight” Carbon Series package, which added a polycarbonate engine cover, exposed carbon-fiber stripes, and an Akrapovič titanium exhaust. It is finished in Shadow Black over a black Alcantara interior, and power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. The car is further equipped with carbon-fiber mirrors, 20" gloss carbon-fiber wheels with titanium lug nuts, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, and a rear diffuser. Purchased new by the seller, this Ford GT has 80 miles and is now offered in Ohio with the ordering kit, a window sticker, the owner's manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title in the name of the seller's LLC.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 80-Mile 2021 Ford GT Carbon Series at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #200,737.

The Chris Svensson-designed second-generation GT debuted at the 2015 North American International Auto Show and entered production in December 2016 at Multimatic’s Markham, Ontario, assembly facility. This example is finished Shadow Black with exposed carbon-fiber stripes. Additional details include LED headlights, carbon-fiber mirrors, a lightweight Gorilla Glass windshield, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, LED taillights, and a rear diffuser. Paint protection film has been applied to the body, which has also received a ceramic coating. Variable ride height, front-axle lift system, selectable driving modes, and launch control are standard features. The Carbon Series package saved approximately 40 pounds and features exposed carbon-fiber stripes, carbon-fiber wheels, a titanium exhaust system, titanium lug nuts, and a polycarbonate engine cover with increased ventilation. Staggered-width 20″ gloss carbon-fiber wheels feature titanium lug nuts and are mounted with Michelin tires. The cabin features black Alcantara over the Sparco seats with manually reclining carbon-fiber shells, while exposed carbon fiber is visible on the door panels. The fixed-position driver seat is paired with an adjustable pedal box and steering column, and additional equipment includes carpeted floor mats, machined pedals, automatic climate control, and a touchscreen infotainment system. The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features carbon-fiber trim and fronts paddle shifters along with a configurable digital instrument panel. The digital odometer indicates 80 miles. The mid-mounted twin-turbocharged 3.5L EcoBoost V6 features a carbon-fiber engine cover and was factory rated at 660 horsepower and 550 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a Getrag seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. An Akrapovič titanium exhaust system is fitted along with carbon-fiber aero panels fore and aft. The window sticker lists initial delivery to Galpin Ford of North Hills, California, along with factory colors, equipment, options, and a total MSRP of $615,350.
